list_definition.definition: knowledge gained by observation and experiment.
a branch of such knowledge eg biology, chemistry, physics etc
these sciences considered as a whole

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: My daughter prefers science to languages.

list_ex_of_english: Consider how we might begin to work out my earlier suggestions about a critical approach to contemporary science.
The fact that we can dream up a use for the associated behaviour is not sufficient to put a hypothesis on the table of science.
Science shows the unity, art shows the diversity of the riddle which we call the world.
Anxiety about the relativist abyss in which 'all pasts are equal' has thwarted efforts to evaluate alternatives to 'objective science'.
It is this challenge that puts on the table new theoretical issues for social science and public policy.
Put simply, neuroscience and developmental science have shown that early life is a time of truly remarkable growth in terms of both brain and behavior.
This affinity to the methods of the natural sciences reduces social science to a technical enterprise which has no necessary value implications.
To be sure, virtually any work of history or social science invokes some species of causal argument.
